Articles.Content:
I've played KSP for a couple weeks and I'm really enjoying it. I've used 3D Studio Max for a very very long time but I'm not very good. I'm making parts for Wing Commander-inspired spaceplanes and I wanted community advice before I got too far into it. Here's what I have so far (several parts are mirrored instances)

And here's the same model exploded with approximate connection points indicated

Of course, everything after the fuselage will use the in-game symmetry.

I know it's a lot to learn at once, but I imagine that I can accomplish this... with a little help.

For it to actually function without cheats it'll pretty much have to have to be cheaty itself, so it adds to my questions if anyone's willing to answer them.

  1. Do I have to have cockpit internals? Not that I won't get around to it, if I could just skip it for now it'd be nice.
  2. Can I have a part contain multiple fuels, like both LFO and RCS fuel?
  3. Is the weight of fuel automatically calculated? Is the thrust automatically calculated based on how much fuel is used? Is there anyway I can override these to make it irrealistic but more practical to play with?
  4. Can I displace the effect on the center of lift, thrust and mass to make it artificially aerodynamic?
  5. Will my arrangement work or will I run into a lot of issues with being unable to place parts?
  6. Does part placement rely on collision frames?

The point I'm at right now is putting the cockpit in Unity and reading a tutorial on it. I'll probably be obsessed with this the rest of the day because I really don't have much else to do.
And right now I'm trying to get the cockpit into KSP. The model and texture show up in the debug thing but I don't think the config is u.u

1. Do I have to have cockpit internals? Not that I won't get around to it, if I could just skip it for now it'd be nice.
    No you don't have to have internals for basic functionality. You can also temporarily use one of the stock ones.
  2. Can I have a part contain multiple fuels, like both LFO and RCS fuel?
    Yup, you just define which it has in the .cfg. Look at squad's fuel tanks to see how they set up resources.
  3. Is the weight of fuel automatically calculated? Is the thrust automatically calculated based on how much fuel is used? Is there anyway I can override these to make it irrealistic but more practical to play with?
    The weight of resources is automatically calculated. The rest I'm unsure of sorry.
  4. Can I displace the effect on the center of lift, thrust and mass to make it artificially aerodynamic?
  5. Will my arrangement work or will I run into a lot of issues with being unable to place parts?
  6. Does part placement rely on collision frames?
    Collision meshes and stack nodes defined in the part's .cfg.

I hope this helps, the models look nice.

That plane would look really cool if you manage to pull this off, good luck. Where is the fuel supposed to come from? Is the fuselage where the fuel is stored, or does it use some strange system? Or do you have to add in your own fuel?
I'm still figuring it out. Right now I just want my cockpit to show up in KSP so I can move on.

I've rewritten the part.cfg file like 5 times, reexported from 3dsmax like 10 times, and while I can get it to show up in unity I can't get it to work in KSP. I am kind of drunk right now and have had a really busy day but I swear I'll figure this out.
